repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:

The root dir function is not passed any context and can only assume the
current buffer is the one being attached.

The main use case is for getting the path of the buffer using
`nvim_buf_get_name`.

Solution:

Pass the buffer number as the first argument.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
--- initialization. If a function, it is passed the buffer number and a callback argument which must be called with
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -286,9 +286,9 @@ end
 --- @field root_markers? string[]
 ---
 --- Directory where the LSP server will base its workspaceFolders, rootUri, and rootPath on
---- initialization. If a function, it accepts a single callback argument which must be called with
+--- initialization. If a function, it is passed buffer number and a callback argument which must be called with

comment_data.body: Can we add a test where we use the buffer number?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6348,7 +6348,7 @@ describe('LSP', function()
         vim.lsp.config('foo', {
           cmd = server.cmd,
           filetypes = { 'foo' },
-          root_dir = function(cb)
+          root_dir = function(_bufnr, cb)

comment_data.body: Do you have any suggestions? Do you mean just add a line that uses the buffer number?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6348,7 +6348,7 @@ describe('LSP', function()
         vim.lsp.config('foo', {
           cmd = server.cmd,
           filetypes = { 'foo' },
-          root_dir = function(cb)
+          root_dir = function(_bufnr, cb)

comment_data.body:
Yeah? What's the output of `nvim_buf_get_name` when called from the tests?

Feel free to not add the test if you find the check not useful.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -6348,7 +6348,7 @@ describe('LSP', function()
         vim.lsp.config('foo', {
           cmd = server.cmd,
           filetypes = { 'foo' },
-          root_dir = function(cb)
+          root_dir = function(_bufnr, cb)

comment_data.body:
should we make the first arg a kwargs-style dict?
```suggestion
      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(ctx: { bufnr: integer }, cb:fun(root_dir?:string))`)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -678,13 +678,13 @@ Lua module: vim.lsp                                                 *lsp-core*
                          the LSP server will base its workspaceFolders,
                          rootUri, and rootPath on initialization. Unused if
                          `root_dir` is provided.
-      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(cb:fun(string))`) Directory where the
-                         LSP server will base its workspaceFolders, rootUri,
-                         and rootPath on initialization. If a function, it
-                         accepts a single callback argument which must be
-                         called with the value of root_dir to use. The LSP
-                         server will not be started until the callback is
-                         called.
+      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(bufnr: integer, cb:fun(root_dir?:string))`)

comment_data.body:
It's more future proof, but would be worse if we never end up adding more context variables.

Are there any hypothetical vars we could add in the future? We should know almost all the use cases by now.

If you look at the code calling into this, there doesn't seem like there's really anything else to pass through.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -678,13 +678,13 @@ Lua module: vim.lsp                                                 *lsp-core*
                          the LSP server will base its workspaceFolders,
                          rootUri, and rootPath on initialization. Unused if
                          `root_dir` is provided.
-      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(cb:fun(string))`) Directory where the
-                         LSP server will base its workspaceFolders, rootUri,
-                         and rootPath on initialization. If a function, it
-                         accepts a single callback argument which must be
-                         called with the value of root_dir to use. The LSP
-                         server will not be started until the callback is
-                         called.
+      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(bufnr: integer, cb:fun(root_dir?:string))`)

comment_data.body: If Client and Config are already available via `self`, I can't think of anything else :)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -678,13 +678,13 @@ Lua module: vim.lsp                                                 *lsp-core*
                          the LSP server will base its workspaceFolders,
                          rootUri, and rootPath on initialization. Unused if
                          `root_dir` is provided.
-      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(cb:fun(string))`) Directory where the
-                         LSP server will base its workspaceFolders, rootUri,
-                         and rootPath on initialization. If a function, it
-                         accepts a single callback argument which must be
-                         called with the value of root_dir to use. The LSP
-                         server will not be started until the callback is
-                         called.
+      • {root_dir}?      (`string|fun(bufnr: integer, cb:fun(root_dir?:string))`)

title: fix(lsp)!: pass buffer number to root_dir function
